Description: This template creates an Autoscaling Group and Launch Configuration to deploy a STIG-hardened EL7 Linux instance to host the GitLab service/application.

AdminPubkeyURL.Description: URL the file containing the admin users' SSH public keys.

AmiId.Description: ID of the AMI to launch

AppVolumeDevice.Description: Decision whether to mount an extra EBS volume. Leave as default ("false") to launch without an extra application volume

AppVolumeMountPath.Description: Filesystem path to mount the extra app volume. Ignored if "AppVolumeDevice" is blank

AppVolumeSize.Description: Size in GB of the EBS volume to create. Ignored if "AppVolumeDevice" is blank

AppVolumeType.Description: Type of EBS volume to create. Ignored if "AppVolumeDevice" is blank

BackupBucket.Description: S3 Bucket to host backups of GitLab config-data

BackupFolder.Description: Folder in S3 Bucket to host backups of GitLab config-data

CfnEndpointUrl.Description: (Optional) URL to the CloudFormation Endpoint. e.g. https://cloudformation.us-east-1.amazonaws.com

CloudWatchAgentUrl.Description: (Optional) S3 URL to CloudWatch Agent installer. Example: s3://amazoncloudwatch-agent/linux/amd64/latest/AmazonCloudWatchAgent.zip

ConfigBucketPath.Description: S3 bucket-path to GitLab configuration template-file.

DesiredCapacity.Description: Desired number of instances in the Autoscaling Group

GitLabConfScript.Description: URL of the script that localizes GitLab for running in the target environment

GitLabPrepScript.Description: URL of the script that preps the OS to host GitLab

GitLabRpmName.Description: Name of GitLab RPM to install. Include release version if 'other-than-latest' is desired. Example values would be: gitlab-ce, gitlab-ce-X.Y.Z

GitLabRpmSourceUri.Description: Url from which to download the Yum repository-definition for GitLab.

GitRepoShareType.Description: Type of network share hosting persisted git repository content.

GitRepoShareUri.Description: URI of network share hosting persisted git repository content.

InstanceRoleName.Description: (Optional) IAM instance-role name used by cfn-init to authenticate to the CloudFormation endpoint.

InstanceRoleProfile.Description: (Optional) IAM instance-role profile to apply to the instance(s)

KeyPairName.Description: Public/private key pairs allow you to securely connect to your instance after it launches

LoadBalancerNames.Description: Comma-separated string of Classic ELB Names to associate with the Autoscaling Group; conflicts with TargetGroupArns

MaxCapacity.Description: Maximum number of instances in the Autoscaling Group

MinCapacity.Description: Minimum number of instances in the Autoscaling Group

NoPublicIp.Description: Controls whether to assign the instance a public IP. Recommended to leave at "true" _unless_ launching in a public subnet

NoReboot.Description: Controls whether to reboot the instance as the last step of cfn-init execution

NoUpdates.Description: Controls whether to run yum update during a stack update (on the initial instance launch, Watchmaker _always_ installs updates)

ProxyName.ConstraintDescription: Alphanumeric string DNS FQDN representing the RDS end-point name.

RdsDbAdmin.ConstraintDescription: Alphanumeric string representing the RDS database-user name.

RdsDbHost.ConstraintDescription: Alphanumeric string DNS FQDN representing the RDS end-point name.

RdsDbInstance.ConstraintDescription: Alphanumeric string representing the RDS database instance.

RootVolumeSize.Description: Size in GB of the EBS volume to create. If smaller than AMI default, create operation will fail; If larger, root device-volume's partition size will be increased

ScaleDownSchedule.Description: (Optional) Scheduled Action in cron-format (UTC) to scale down to MinCapacity; ignored if empty or ScaleUpSchedule is unset (E.g. "0 0 * * *")

ScaleUpSchedule.Description: (Optional) Scheduled Action in cron-format (UTC) to scale up to MaxCapacity; ignored if empty or ScaleDownSchedule is unset (E.g. "0 10 * * Mon-Fri")

SecurityGroupIds.Description: List of security groups to apply to the instance(s)

SubnetIds.Description: List of subnets to associate to the Autoscaling Group

TargetGroupArns.Description: Comma-separated string of Target Group ARNs to associate with the Autoscaling Group; conflicts with LoadBalancerNames

ToggleCfnInitUpdate.Description: A/B toggle that forces a change to instance metadata, triggering the cfn-init update sequence

ToggleNewInstances.Description: A/B toggle that forces a change to instance userdata, triggering new instances via the Autoscale update policy

WatchmakerAdminGroups.Description: (Optional) Colon-separated list of domain groups that should have admin permissions on the EC2 instance

WatchmakerAdminUsers.Description: (Optional) Colon-separated list of domain users that should have admin permissions on the EC2 instance

WatchmakerAvailable.Description: Specify if Watchmaker is available (if "false" all other Watchmaker-related parms will be ignored).

WatchmakerComputerName.Description: (Optional) Sets the hostname/computername within the OS

WatchmakerConfig.Description: (Optional) Path to a Watchmaker config file.  The config file path can be a remote source (i.e. http[s]://, s3://) or local directory (i.e. file://)

WatchmakerEnvironment.Description: Environment in which the instance is being deployed

WatchmakerOuPath.Description: (Optional) DN of the OU to place the instance when joining a domain. If blank and "WatchmakerEnvironment" enforces a domain join, the instance will be placed in a default container. Leave blank if not joining a domain, or if "WatchmakerEnvironment" is "false"

Fn::Join:
[Unit]
Description=Reconfigure GitLab to work on this host
After=multi-user.target

[Service]
Type=oneshot
ExecStart=/etc/cfn/scripts/glprep.sh

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

#!/bin/bash
#
# Script to backup GitLab data to S3 bucket
#################################################################
PROGNAME=$(basename "${0}")
LOGFACIL="user.err"
for VAR in $(cat /etc/cfn/GitLab.envs)
do
   export $VAR
done
BUCKET="${GITLAB_BACKUP_BUCKET:-UNDEF}"
FOLDER="${GITLAB_BACKUP_FOLDER:-UNDEF}"
REGION="${GITLAB_AWS_REGION:-UNDEF}"
DAYSUB="$(date '+%A')"
SRCDIR=/var/opt/gitlab/backups/
            
# Set up flexible logging
function err_exit {
   echo "${1}"
   logger -t "${PROGNAME}" -p ${LOGFACIL} "${1}"
   exit 1
}

# Create GitLab archive file
printf "Creating backup archive-file in s3://%s..." "${BUCKET}"
gitlab-rake gitlab:backup:create STRATEGY=copy DIRECTORY="${FOLDER}" 
CRON=1 &&  echo "Success" || 
err_exit 'Failed creating backup archive-file'
